main event: On October 14, 1962, three bright objects were observed in Granby, Quebec, moving with a shaped elliptical motion and disappearing into the clouds.
interesting points: The objects were described as being brighter than car headlights and were observed moving in the same direction at approximately 2,000 mph., The sighting lasted about 225 seconds with each object visible for around 5 to 6 seconds., The weather was clear with bright daylight conditions, and the objects did not emit any sound, smoke, or change shape., Observations were made from inside a house without any light interference, allowing a clear view of the objects., The witness has prior experience with UFO sightings, indicating a longstanding interest and credibility in the observations.
sighted object: three bright elliptical objects in the sky
witness description: Senior Engineering Technician with a background in physics and previous UFO sightings.
